sub_title: Team Leader of the PMST for FCDO's Forest Governance, Markets and Climate (FGMC) Programme at Pegasys
summary: Marieke Wit is an expert in sustainable management of natural resources and value chains. She graduated in tropical forestry at the Wageningen University. Since then, she has been working with a variety of actors to improve the management of natural resources through a/o facilitating multi-stakeholder processes to generate broadly supported solutions to complex issues such as illegal timber production and trade. She has also worked directly with private companies to improve the sustainability of their production, both for timber and agriculture supply chains. Since 2015 she works for FCDO's Forest Governance Markets and Climate Programme, a 10-year programme focusing on policy and legal reforms that eliminate illegal logging and illegal deforestation, establish transparency, promote legal trade and ensure rights and benefits for local communities.

projects:
[{'title': 'European Tropical Forest Research Network (ETFRN)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Coordinator of ETFRN’s network and development of thematic publications (ETFRN News). 
ETFRN aims to ensure that European research contributes to conservation and sustainable use of forest and tree resources in tropical and subtropical countries. ETFRN promotes a dialogue between researchers, policy-makers and forest users, the increased coherence of European tropical forest research, and increased collaboration with researchers in developing countries through partnerships and other forms of capacity building.
ETFRN provides a range of services, including ETFRN News, which comprises theme-based issues on research relevant to the international development agenda. 
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marieke', 'last_name': 'Wit', 'name': None, 'headline': "Team Leader of the PMST for FCDO's Forest Governance, Markets and Climate (FGMC) Programme at Pegasys"}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': '+ Add team member', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'EU chainsaw milling project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Overall coordinator: The EU Chainsaw Milling Project aims to find solutions to the problems associated with the production of lumber for local timber markets. The project involves stakeholders in dialogue, information gathering and the development of alternatives to unsustainable chainsaw milling practices. The project has two phases: (1) developing alternatives for illegal chainsaw milling through a Multi-stakeholder Dialogue in Ghana and Guyana (March 2007–April 2013); and (2) supporting the integration of legal and legitimate domestic markets into the Voluntary Partnership Agreements (April 2011–April 2015). The project is being implemented by Tropenbos International in collaboration with the Forestry Commission and the Forestry Research Institute of Ghana in Ghana, and the Forestry Training Centre and Iwokrama in Guyana.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Marieke', 'last_name': 'Wit', 'name': None, 'headline': "Team Leader of the PMST for FCDO's Forest Governance, Markets and Climate (FGMC) Programme at Pegasys"}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Rohini Kerrett', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'James Parker Mckeown', 'headline': None}]}]

As part of global efforts to improve forest management and tackle deforestation, FGMC supports the EU Forest Law Enforcement, Governance and Trade (FLEGT) Action Plan  which tackles illegal logging in timber-producing developing countries and the trade in illegally-produced timber products. The EU’s FLEGT Action Plan was established in 2003 and sets out a range of measures available to the EU and its member states to tackle illegal logging in the world's forests. 

DFID has established the Programme Management Support Team (PMST) as a self-contained team, housed in KPMG, to support DFID in delivering the FGMC programme.", 'title': "Technical Coordinator of the PMST for DFID's Forest Governance Markets and Climate (FGMC) Progamme", 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1386507, 'name': 'Tropenbos International', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGMdt_QJdVdMw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519914397027?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=-zUSSSVTNdzaNbBSVa4X40XpaMRozUSAd15CNxWA_Js', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/tropenbos-international/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Wageningen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Tropenbos International', 'description': 'I was responsible for the successful implementation of the EU-funded chainsaw milling project (www.chainsawmilling.org): overlooking the design and implementation of the Multi-Stakeholder Dialogue in Ghana and Guyana; guiding the community activities in 14 pilot districts; supervising the research activities, and; communicating our lessons learned to other countries (DRC, Cameroon, Liberia, Suriname) and the international policy arena. As the overall coordinator, I was managing project teams in Ghana (15 FTE) and Guyana (9 FTE): building their and other stakeholders’ capacity in a/o facilitation, communication, community development, monitoring and evaluation and forest governance; organising annual project coordination meetings and missions; monitoring, evaluating and reporting on the project’s progress and impact, and; managing the budget.

Furthermore I coordinated the European Tropical Forest Research Network (ETFRN), developing theme-based publications (ETFRN News) on research relevant to the international development agenda (www.etfrn.org).

I was also supporting our communication department in developing communication strategies and plans, capacity building of TBI staff on communication, organising TBI events and developing, editing and producing of TBI products, such as publications, brochures, annual reports, website stories, etc. (www.tropenbos.org)', 'title': 'Programme Coordinator', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 297295, 'name': 'Nuon N.V.
